post: 1791 was a momentous year in the history of our countryand its a pretty big deal at the Bill of Rights Institute. That was the year that the Bill of Rights was ratified, putting into law rights all people should enjoy, like freedom of speech, freedom of religion, and due process. By making a gift of $17.91 or more, you join us in supporting a network of 76,000 civics and history teachers who serve approximately 7.6 million students a year. You help us deliver market-leading resources and programs that teach Americas Founding principles and equip educators and young people to live the ideals of a free and just society. Visit  https://lnkd.in/eWfkDJbp to donate.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #1791

Meet Emma Linkugel, the Bill of Rights Institute's 2024 Think the Vote winner! BRI's Think the Vote website provides opportunities for students to learn all sides of current events issues and engage in civil discourse with fellow students from across the country. In the Think the Vote contest, students are encouraged to research, think critically, discuss, and debate events by submitting contributions to the platform. To read about Emma's winning submission, visit  https://lnkd.in/exYVxZF7  #BRI  #debate  #civicengagement
Happy Independence Day from the Bill of Rights Institute! Read BRI President & CEO David Bobb's important Independence Day message below.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #IndependenceDay

Check out the replay from our virtual citizenship fair honoring the winners of the 2024 MyImpact Challenge civic engagement contest! Students from across the country entered their service projects, and our virtual fair showcased our ten winners. Watch here to learn how these students used constitutional principles to serve and strengthen their communities.  https://lnkd.in/evyqnhJH  #BRI  #billofrightsinstitute  #MyImpactChallenge

Congratulations to Brayden Pape, the MyImpact Challenge Third Prize Winner from Helix Charter High School in La Mesa, CA! Brayden began the PATH Interscholastic Leadership Team (PILT) to help people experiencing homelessness in San Diego County. Ready to learn more about Brayden's inspiring project? Read more about his journey and the impact he's making in our community here  https://lnkd.in/e7XhCrxR  #BRI  #billofrightsinstitute  #MyImpactChallenge

Meet Sellers Shockley, our K-8 Content Intern! Sellers is excited to join the Bill of Rights Institute as a intern for the summer. Attending the University of Mississippi and studying Elementary Education and Public Policy Leadership, Sellers is excited to learn and support the K-8 content team in their quest to teach civics and provide resources to teachers and students across the country.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #internship

At the Bill of Rights Institute, we are proud to partner with organizations and companies that support civic educationand Federal Flags, LLC wants to give back to the same cause you support. Interested in purchasing an all-American-made flag before Independence Day? Just make a purchase through Federal Flags using the code 'BRI,' and Federal Flags will donate a portion of each sale to support the Bill of Rights Institute and civic education. Plus, when you use the code 'BRI' at checkout, you will enjoy an additional 5% off on any already-discounted Federal Flags product. Visit  https://lnkd.in/eFFbmjbM.  #billofrightsinstitute  #bri  #americanflag  #july4th

Congratulations to Grace Liu, the MyImpact Challenge Second Prize Winner from Syosset High School in Syosset, NY! Grace founded Research to Empower, which provides free research training to underrepresented populations. Curious to know more about Grace's inspiring project? Read more about her journey and the impact she's making in our community here  https://lnkd.in/e7XhCrxR  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #MyImpactChallenge

Through our Power of the Printed Word campaign, we are working to make pocket constitutions available to teachers and students nationwide. Printing and finishing companies from across America have rallied to help, and have begun donating their services to this great cause. Watch Bill of Rights Institute Director, Corporate Relations Justin Goldstein talk with Kelly Mallozzi, Principal of Success. In. Print, about the campaign and how companies can help put Americas Founding documents in teachers and students hands.  https://lnkd.in/eNSDjhDs Interested in supporting the Power of the Printed Word? Visit  https://lnkd.in/eE-zWeup  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #poweroftheprintedword
